* The first-ever game of Major League Cricket (MLC) in the US will take place on Thursday, with all tickets sold out, between the Texas Super Kings and the Los Angeles Knight Riders at Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.

**Tournament Background**: The inaugural season of Major League Cricket (MLC) was held last year, featuring six teams including the Texas Super Kings, San Francisco Unicorns, Los Angeles Knight Riders, and Seattle Orcas.

**Grand Prairie Stadium**: The 7,200-seat stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas, is home to the Texas Super Kings and hosted games during the inaugural season, attracting 50,000 attendees over two weeks.

**Future Plans**: Investors are planning to build new venues, including stadiums for the San Francisco Unicorns, Los Angeles Knight Riders, and Seattle Orcas, within the next few years.

**Economic Impact**: The three-day playoffs in Grand Prairie generated $1.7 million in economic activity, including hospitality, retail, dining, and entertainment.

**Growth of Cricket in the US**: Cricket is the world's second-most-popular sport, with an estimated 15-20 million fans in the US.
